#7 Linking #knowledge with #action: Sustainability #transitions requires diverse new knowledge, including evidence about the systems driving environmental pressures, pathways to sustainability, promising initiatives & barriers to change. #SOER2020

#6 Managing risks and ensuring a socially fair and #justtransition: Societies must acknowledge potential risks, opportunities and trade-offs, and devise ways to navigate them. Policies have an essential role in this. #SOER2020

#5 Scaling up #investments and reorienting #finance: Sustainability #transitions will require major investments but Europeans stand to gain hugely â€“ both from avoided harms from economic and social opportunities. #SOER2020
#4 Fostering #innovation throughout society: Changing trajectory will depend on the emergence & spread of diverse forms of innovation that can trigger new ways of thinking and living. #SOER2020

#3 Europe cannot achieve sustainability goals alone. The #EU has significant diplomatic & economic influence, which it can use to promote ambitious agreements in #climate, #biodiversity & #resourceuse. #SOER2020
#2 The coverage of long-term policy frameworks needs to be extended to other important systems and issues, starting with the #food system, #chemicals and #LandUse. #SOER2020
#1 Strengthening policy implementation, integration and coherence: Full implementation of existing policies would take #Europe a long way to achieving its environmental goals up to 2030. #SOER2020

#SOER2020 calls for Europe to transform the key societal systems that drive #environment and #climate pressures and #health impacts â€” rethinking not just technologies and production processes but also #consumption patterns and ways of living.
